It relays information obtained from an interview with Joseph C. Merlino, who knew White at KMSC.
summary_one_paragraph: This confidential message, dated September 11, 1982, discusses PFC Joseph Timothy White's defection to North Korea and includes information from an interview with Joseph C. Merlino, a former acquaintance of White's from Kemper Military School & College (KMSC). Merlino provided insights into White's personality, academic performance, and interactions at KMSC, noting White's serious and idealistic nature, his interest in Marxist philosophy, and his admiration for Adolf Hitler. The message also details White's struggles with peer acceptance, his near failure at ROTC advanced camp, and an incident where he set fire to another cadet's door. Merlino expressed that White's defection was not entirely surprising, given his disappointments and disillusionment with U.S. society.
title: Message Regarding Joseph Timothy White
